exposr 0.0.1
  • Reference

Simulate Dose-Response Data from a Quadratic Model

Source: R/simulate_quadratic.R
simulate_quadratic.Rd

Simulates data from a quadratic polynomial model: $$pred = e0 + b1 * dose + b2 * dose^2$$

simulate_quadratic(
  dose_levels,
  n_per_dose,
  e0,
  b1,
  b2,
  sigma,
  dist = "normal",
  df = 3,
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

dose_levels

Numeric vector of dose levels.

n_per_dose

Either a single integer (equal sample size per dose) or a vector matching `dose_levels`.

e0

Baseline effect. Can be a scalar or a vector.

b1

Linear coefficient.

b2

Quadratic coefficient.

sigma

Standard deviation for residual error.

dist

Residual error distribution: `"normal"` (default), `"lognormal"`, `"uniform"`, `"t"`, or `"gamma"`.

df

Degrees of freedom for t-distribution.

seed

Optional seed for reproducibility.

Value

Data frame with columns: `id`, `dose`, `pred`, `ipred`, `scenario` (combination label).

Details

All combinations of `e0`, `b1`, and `b2` will be simulated.

Examples

simulate_quadratic(
  dose_levels = c(0, 1, 5, 10),
  n_per_dose = 10,
  e0 = 0, b1 = 0.5, b2 = -0.02,
  sigma = 0.3,
  dist = "normal",
  seed = 400
)
#>    id dose pred        ipred               scenario
#> 1   1    0 0.00 -0.310964626 e0=0, b1=0.5, b2=-0.02
#> 2   2    0 0.00  0.184584993 e0=0, b1=0.5, b2=-0.02
